title: Tight colorful no-dimension Tverberg theorem
abstract:
We prove a tight colorful dimension-free Tverberg theorem asserting that for
any pairwise disjoint $k$-point sets $Q_1,\dots, Q_r$ in the Euclidean space,
there are a partition of the union $Q_1\cup\dots \cup Q_r$ into $r$-point
subsets $P_1,\dots, P_k$ and a ball of radius $$ \frac{\mathrm{max}_{1\leq
i\leq k}\mathrm{diam} P_i}{\sqrt{2r}} $$ such that each $P_i$ shares with each
$Q_j$ exactly one point and the ball intersects the convex hulls of $P_i$.
